results.title: To each a rightful share
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Donald Fraser and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
This, to the privileged, is a fine-sounding principle; but to the underprivileged it is a call to action. Riots in Africa, India’s violence, China’s new dynamism, Japan’s intense industrialization - all these are seen as part of a great movement. Good historical overview of the rise of industrialization, with particular emphasis on the social affects (the growth in wealth brought on by industrialization).

results.title: To die for = Heaven's a drag
results.creator_credit: Gary Fitzpatrick, TDF Productions, London Lighthouse, British Screen and Peter Mackenzie Litten
results.brief_description: This comedy/drama about the impact of AIDS on a gay relationship draws on the same ‘ghostly lover’ premise as “Ghost” and “Truly, madly, deeply”. Mark, a drag performer, is HIV positive and in poor health. While he spends his last days at home preparing his own AIDS memorial quilt, his spunky young HIV negative boyfriend Simon, in denial about Mark’s impending death, cruises clubs and sleeps with other men. When Mark finally dies, Simon continues to pursue his hedonistic lifestyle until Mark returns to haunt his faithless lover. Mark’s endless beyond-the-grave pranks finally force Simon to face some long-submerged feelings and come to terms with his love and grief. While the patchy script undermines the film’s attempts to bring a comic touch to a serious subject, “To die for” offers a refreshing alternative to other films that focus solely on the horrors of the AIDS virus. Cast includes Thomas Arklie, Ian Williams, Tony Slattery, Dillie Keane.

results.title: To die for
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Laura Ziskin and Gus Van Sant
results.brief_description: Gus Van Sant’s vicious black comedy stars Nicole Kidman as Suzanne Stone, a vapid and celebrity obsessed sociopath whose dream to become a famous TV personality turns into a nightmare for the people around her. In her determined quest for stardom Suzanne bullies her way into a job as a weather woman for a local cable station, much to her husband’s (Matt Dillon) growing displeasure, and shrewdly uses it as a way to instigate her own pet projects. Through one such project, a documentary about teenagers, she meets and befriends three of her subjects, Jimmy (Joaquin Phoenix), Lydia (Alison Folland) and Russell (Casey Affleck), three awkward teens with very low self esteem. Jimmy and Lydia take a particular liking to the glamorous and confident Suzanne who seizes on their crush as a way to manipulate them into helping her achieve her own murderous goals. Buck Henry’s (‘The Graduate’) caustic screenplay is serviced well by Gus Van Sant’s direction, which chronicles Suzanne’s ruthless climb to the top of the American dream through a series of first hand accounts from the various characters. Joaquin Phoenix and Alison Folland are impressive as the painfully shy teens, while Kidman’s performance is spot on as the cold and calculating Suzanne. Cast also includes Illeana Douglas and Dan Hedaya. (Awards: Golden Globe Award for Best Actress-Nicole Kidman) See also ‘Drugstore Cowboy’, ‘My own private Idaho’, ‘Good Will Hunting’.

results.title: To die - to live: the survivors of Hiroshima
results.creator_credit: Robert Vas and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
By talking with survivors, the bombing of Hiroshima is reconstructed together with dramatic pictures, creating an impression of what it would be like to “live” through an A-bomb experience. Made in collaboration with Prof. Robert Jay Lifton and based on his book “Death in life”.

results.title: To clone or leave alone
results.brief_description: The cloning of Dolly the sheep focused world attention on the future of human cloning. Suddenly the possibility seemed much closer. But, as we see in this program, cloning has been going on for years. In 1966 Dr. Joshua Lederberg first cloned tadpoles and since then cloning in the plant and animal kingdom has proceeded at a rapid pace. This program looks at the advantages and disadvantages of cloning and the moral and ethical issues surrounding the scientific possibilities. Includes teachers notes.

results.title: To climb a mountain
results.creator_credit: Dennis Passaggio, BFA Educational Media and Ted Abenheim
results.brief_description: Shows how blindness is a handicap that can be overcome. Presents a story about a young man and woman and a group of their friends who successfully climb a mountain. Explores their feelings about their accomplishments as blind people and examines the attitudes of society about blindness.

results.title: To Chapultepec = A Chapultepec
results.brief_description: This film provides some cultural background to Mexico, especially Chapultepec to students learning elementary Spanish with the text “Entender Y Hablar”. This is a spanish language film that includes new words which describe what four young people do in the city for fun. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: To Catch a thief
results.brief_description: The French Riviera serves as the picturesque backdrop for this classic, suspenseful Hitchcock caper with Cary Grant as John Robie, a reformed cat burglar once known as “The Cat”, suspected in a new wave of jewel thefts from luxury hotels. Meeting pampered heiress Frances (Grace Kelly at her most ravishing), he sees the chance to bait the mysterious thief with her mothers’ (Jessie Royce Landis) fabulous jewels and clear himself of suspicion. His plan backfires, but Frances, who believes him guilty, proves her love by helping him escape and in a spine-tingling climax, the real criminal is exposed. Script including the much-imitated fireworks scene by John Michael Hayes. The cinematography by Robert Burks won the Oscar for Best Cinematography, 1954. Co-starring John Williams, Charles Vanel, Brigitte Auber, Jean Martinelli and Georgette Anys. Based on the novel by David Dodge.

results.title: To build a school house
results.brief_description: Contrasts traditional school building design with modern requirements, showing planning for changes with movable partitions, provision for such needs as language laboratories and visual instruction centres, and ways of adapting existing buildings
